You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Account Address Books and Contact Addresses for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Buyers

B2B Commerce for Visualforce stores a buyer's billing and shipping address information across a set of custom object records. B2B Commerce creates these records when a buyer registers for an account from the Site Register page or creates an address from the My Account page. These records also populate address fields during checkout.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)

The custom objects that B2B Commerce for Visualforce creates are:

CC Contact Address
The details for a specific address, including:
The first and last name of an addressee
Up to three lines of a street address
The city, state, country or territory, and postal code
A company name
CC Account Address Book
The junction object that:
Associates a specific contact address with a specific account
Specifies whether the address is for shipping or billing, and whether it's the default shipping or billing address
NOTE The managed package installs another custom object, CC Address Book, which is deprecated.
TIP If an admin manually enables contacts as storefront buyers, make sure that you create the appropriate contact address and account address book records. This step ensures that the contact has addresses available in the Manage Address Book section of the storefront's My Account page.
Different Shipping and Billing Addresses

When a buyer specifies different addresses for shipping and billing, B2B Commerce for Visualforce assigns the following record relationships:

The buyer's account (1) is related to an account address book record (2), where Address Type is Shipping.
A contact address record (3), which contains the shipping address details, is related to the account address book for shipping (2).
The buyer's account (1) is also related to another account address book record (4), where Address Type is Billing.
Another contact address record (5), which contains the billing address details, is related to the account address book for billing (4).
NOTE A buyer can edit an address from the Manage Address Book section of the My Account page so that the address applies to billing and shipping. In this case, B2B Commerce for Visualforce deletes one of the contact address records.
Same Shipping and Billing Address

When a buyer specifies an address that applies to both shipping and billing, B2B Commerce for Visualforce assigns records differently depending on the use case:

If the buyer adds the address when self-registering, B2B Commerce for Visualforce still creates two contact address records, even though the address details are the same.
If the buyer adds the address from the Manage Address Book section of the My Account page, B2B Commerce for Visualforce creates only one contact address:
The buyer's account (1) is related to an account address book record (2), where Address Type is Shipping.
The buyer's account (1) is also related to another account address book record (3), where Address Type is Billing.
A contact address record (4), which contains the address details for both shipping and billing, is related to both account address books (2, 3).
Default Shipping or Billing Address

An account address book record provides a Default field. This field indicates whether its associated contact address is selected by default as the billing or shipping address during checkout.

However, B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn't enforce a limit of only one default billing or shipping address. You can enable Default on multiple account address book records. When multiple default billing or shipping addresses exist, B2B Commerce for Visualforce references whichever record most recently had its Default field enabled.

Contact Address Records Created at Checkout

When a guest buyer completes checkout, B2B Commerce for Visualforce creates the following contact address records:

A shipping address related to the cart
A billing address related to the cart
A shipping address related to the order
A billing address related to the order

When a registered buyer completes checkout, B2B Commerce for Visualforce creates the following contact address records:

A shipping address related to the cart
A billing address related to the cart
A shipping address related to the order
A billing address related to the order
A shipping address related to the invoice
A billing address related to the invoice
